name: Guisarmiere
description:
You are trained in the use of heavy polearms.

While wielding any polearm, you have the following abilities:

  • You may use a half action to make an attack with the butt end, dealing 1d4 damage on a hit, or spending 1 MP to increase the damage to 1d6.

  • Any time you land a hit and either beat the foe's Defense by at least 3 or roll max damage, you may spend 1 MP to inflict Injury (this applies to hits with either end of the polearm).

  • If the polearm can be thrown, you may halve its range and use Strength instead of Dexterity to fling it with extreme force, dealing +1d damage on a hit.

improvements.name: Takedown
improvements.description: Whenever you roll max damage with either end of a polearm, you may roll Strength vs Dexterity against the foe you hit, knocking them prone on a win.

improvements.name: Brace For Impact
improvements.description: When you take the defensive stance while wielding a polearm two-handed, you instead gain +WITS Defense. If any foes make a melee attack against you while in this stance, roll your Strength vs their Dexterity instead of rolling engagement.

improvements.name: Wide Berth
improvements.description: Foes provoke opportunity attacks from you if they enter the radius of your polearm's reach. On a hit, their movement is stopped and they cannot move further this turn.

improvements.name: Deep Impact
improvements.description:
Whenever you inflict Injury with a polearm, you may spend 1 MP to lodge the weapon in the wound. The foe takes -2 Defense and their speed is halved while it remains in place.

It takes a half action to remove the weapon, and doing so provokes a roll of Dexterity vs the foe's current Injury to see how carefully they remove it. On a loss, the foe rolls Injury again, as the removal causes more damage.
